result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Duane Thayer

defendant.name: Thayer, Kevin Duane
defendant.address: 13863 W. Agency Rd., Stone Lake, WI 54876

records.addlTxt:
Quashed on record 10/21/22
2 Certified copies returned from PRSO

If not already completed Defendant must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

11:02 AM Defendant Kevin Duane Thayer appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer appeared by video for Kevin Duane Thayer.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Restemayer gives statements in regards to the non-appearance of his client at the last hearing. Defendant explains he was in between residences and got the mail for the hearing too late. ADA Fuhr moves to quash the warrant. Court orders the warrant quashed. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. ADA Fuhr gives bond recommendations. Bond ordered as requested. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Clerk is to fax the bond form to Sawyer County Jail at the conclusion of this hearing. Comments by parties.
Return on warrant on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:23 AM Defendant Kevin Duane Thayer not in court.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court requests adjourning initial appearance due to non- service. DA Kelz motions for an Arrest warrant. Court states DA Kelz can submit the warrant and the court will review it.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
